flowRoot.flowPara: On a Rack call, a Derailleur application will:
- look in its tree for a matching node (it removes the extension of the URL)
- take the node's dispatcher (not only leaves can have dispatchers)
- get the application handler corresponding to the dispatching HTTP verb
- call the application handler within the routing handler (the routing handler knows how to handle many different things)
- return the Rack call with the handler's return value
If there is any error, the error handler will take over.
By registering paths, derailleur builds the whole tree for you.
It also prune the useless routes fom the tree for you whenever you remove a registration.
- wildcards ':foo' which absorb exactly one node, and match any value
- stars '*' which absorbs a full tree beneath them
Handlers can then access these values
Normal nodes take precedence. Any node can have only one special child.
